text: 人工知能により自立自爆が決議されました / 始まったの? / 発想時は3社一致の後、0人秒で行われます
translation: The self-destruct has been decided by the artificial intelligence. / Has it begun? / The detonation will occur 0 seconds after unanimous agreement by all three.
grammar: Passive voice with により (by means of) indicates the agent performing the action in formal/technical speech.

text: 自爆範囲は中い度深度280、140、0フロアです特例 / 5、8、2、発動をかむため / マル / タザル、さら
translation: The self-destruct range is central depth 280, 140, floor 0. Special provision 582 is activated. / Balthasar, further...
grammar: Technical announcement style using です for formal declarations in emergency situations.

text: にカッパーに侵入 / 押 / されてるぞ、なんて速度だ
translation: It's invading Caspar! / We're being pushed back! What speed!
grammar: なんて + noun is an exclamatory expression showing surprise or amazement (What [noun]!).

text: 自爆装置作動まであと20秒 / いかん!カスパー!18秒後に乗っ取られます! / 自爆装置作動まであと15秒 / リ / ツコ!急いで! / 大丈夫?
translation: 20 seconds until self-destruct activation. / No good! Caspar will be taken over in 18 seconds! / 15 seconds until self-destruct activation. / Ritsuko! Hurry! / Are you okay?
grammar: まで + あと + time expression indicates countdown (X time left until...).

text: 1秒近くも余裕があるわ / 1秒って! / 0のマ / イナスじゃない
translation: We have nearly a whole second to spare. / One second?! / That's not even zero minus!
grammar: も after a quantity adds emphasis, often implying 'as much as' or sarcastically 'only'.

text: マヤ!いけます! / 4秒!3秒!2秒!1秒!0秒!
translation: Maya! We can do it! / 4 seconds! 3 seconds! 2 seconds! 1 second! 0 seconds!

vocabulary.meaning: to be able to do, to work out

grammar: いけます is the polite potential form of いく used idiomatically to mean 'it will work' or 'we can make it'.

text: 人工知能により自立自爆が解除されました
translation: The autonomous self-destruct has been cancelled by the artificial intelligence.
grammar: により marks the agent in passive constructions in formal/written Japanese.

text: なお特例582も解除されました
translation: Additionally, Special Provision 582 has also been cancelled.
grammar: なお is a formal conjunction used in announcements to add supplementary information.

text: マギシステム通常モードに戻ります
translation: The MAGI system is returning to normal mode.
grammar: に戻る means 'to return to (a state)' - に marks the destination/state being returned to.

text: R警報解除 / R警報解除
translation: R-alert cancelled. R-alert cancelled.
grammar: Noun + noun compounds without particles are common in announcements and headlines for brevity.

text: 総員第一種警戒態勢に移行してください / 何がどうなってんだろう
translation: All personnel, please transition to Level 1 alert status. / What's going on, I wonder?
grammar: どうなってんだろう is casual contraction of どうなっているんだろう, expressing wondering/puzzlement.

text: もう裸じゃどこにも出れないじゃないの
translation: I can't go out anywhere naked anymore!
grammar: じゃ is casual contraction of では; じゃないの at end expresses complaint or frustration.

text: 早く誰か助けて
translation: Someone help me, quickly!
grammar: Te-form alone (助けて) functions as an urgent request/command, more desperate than 助けてください.

text: シグマユニット開放 / マギシステム再開まで / マイナスゼロサンです
translation: Sigma Unit opened. / Until MAGI system restart: / minus zero-three.
grammar: まで indicates 'until' a point in time; countdown announcements often use まで + time remaining.

text: もう年かしらね / 徹夜が答えるわ / また約束守ってくれたわね / お疲れさん
translation: I wonder if I'm getting old. / Pulling all-nighters is taking its toll. / You kept your promise again. / Good work.
grammar: かしらね is feminine sentence-ending expressing wondering or uncertainty, softer than かな.

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.
grammar: Simple expression of gratitude; more casual than ありがとうございます.

text: ミサトの入れてくれたコーヒーを / こんなに美味いと思ったのは初めてだわ
translation: This is the first time I've thought / the coffee Misato made was this good.
grammar: てくれた indicates someone did something for the speaker's benefit (making coffee for her).

text: 死ぬ前の晩母さんが言ってたわ / マギは三人の自分なんだって
translation: The night before she died, my mother said / that MAGI is three versions of herself.
grammar: んだって is casual quotative, reporting what someone said (= と言っていた).

text: 科学者としての自分 / 母としての自分 / 女としての自分
translation: Herself as a scientist. / Herself as a mother. / Herself as a woman.
grammar: として means 'as' (in the role/capacity of); としての + noun = 'as a [noun]'.

text: その三人が攻めき合っているのがマギなのよ
translation: MAGI is those three arguing with each other.
grammar: Verb stem + 合う indicates mutual/reciprocal action (arguing with each other).

text: 人の持つジレンマをわざと残したのね / 実はプログラムを微妙に変えてあるのよ
translation: She deliberately left in the dilemmas that humans have. / Actually, I've slightly modified the program.
grammar: てある indicates a resultant state from a deliberate action (the program has been changed and remains so).

text: 私は母親にはなれそうもないから / 母としての母さんはわからないわ
translation: Since I probably won't become a mother myself, / I don't understand my mother as a mother.
grammar: そうもない expresses strong doubt that something will happen (unlikely to become).

text: だけど科学者としてのあの人は尊敬もしていた
translation: But I did respect her as a scientist.
grammar: も after 尊敬 adds nuance of 'even' or 'also' - implying other feelings existed alongside respect.

text: でもね、女としては憎んでさえいたの
translation: But as a woman, I even hated her.
grammar: さえ means 'even' and emphasizes an extreme case - she went so far as to hate her.

text: 今日はおしゃべりじゃない / たまにはね
translation: You're talkative today. / Once in a while.
grammar: じゃない here is observational (You're talkative, aren't you?) not negative.

text: カスパーにはね / 女としてのパターンがインプットされていたの
translation: In Caspar, you see, / the pattern of herself as a woman was inputted.
grammar: されていた is past progressive passive - 'had been inputted' indicating completed past action.

text: 最後まで女でいることを守ったのね / ほんと、母さんらしいわ
translation: She protected being a woman until the very end. / That's really just like my mother.
grammar: Noun + らしい means 'typical of' or 'just like' that noun (母さんらしい = so like mother).

text: 致命中
translation: [Episode title card] Fatal Hit / To Be Continued
grammar: This appears to be an episode title or preview card text.
